column3: What a good idea! Why didn't I think {{c1::of}} that?
You look very serious. What are you thinking {{c1::about}}?
I don't want to go out with Tom tonight. I'll have to think {{c1::of}} an excuse.
I don't think much {{c1::of}} this coffee. It's like water.

A: Will you help me?
B: I'm not sure. I'll think {{c1::about}} it.
I need time to make decisions. I like to think {{c1::about}} things carefully.

A: I had a strange dream.
B: Did you? What did you dream {{c1::about}}?
I love living here. I wouldn't dream {{c1::of}} going anywhere else.
Paul was complaining {{c1::of}} pains in his chest, so he went to see the doctor.
Our neighbours complained to us {{c1::about}} the noise we made.
I would have forgotten my appointment if you hadn't reminded me {{c1::about}} it.
I love this music. It reminds me {{c1::of}} a warm day in spring.
